title: ONLY 1 LEFT: RARE 19th Century Baseball Woodcuts w/HOF'ers
author: bcbgcbrcb

posts.post_title: ONLY 1 LEFT: RARE 19th Century Baseball Woodcuts w/HOF'ers
posts.post_content:
Good Evening, Collectors:

Up for sale tonight is a group of (5) - 19th Century Baseball Woodcuts, each containing at least 1 Hall of Famer. Here is a list of the 5 woodcuts available along with individual prices for each:

1868 Sporting Life Imperial-Size - George Wright & Harry Wright (BGS) @ $SOLD

1885 Cincinnati Graphic - St. Louis Browns w/Charles Comiskey, Bob Caruthers, Dave Foutz (12 St. Louis Browns portraits in total) @ $SOLD

1885 Harper's Weekly - 12 portraits including 5 HOF'ers: Charles Radbourn, Buck Ewing, King Kelly, Jim O'Rourke & John Ward @ $SOLD

1882 Harper's Weekly Complete Issue - Providence Team including 4 Hall of Famers: George Wright, Harry Wright, Charles Radbourn & John Ward @ $SOLD

1890 Sporting Life - Cleveland (NL) Team w/George Davis @ $50.00

Please review scans of the woodcuts for condition details. The first person to e-mail me on each and say "I'll take it" is the new owner. My e-mail address is: [url]vguerrerobb@yahoo.com[/url]
PM sent on the Chicago Team.

posts.post_title: PRICES REDUCED: (5) RARE 19th Century Baseball Woodcuts w/HOF'ers

posts.post_content:
Hi Phil,  Also sent a PM, but I don't think they are going through.

What are the actual measurements on the Sporting Life woodcut of the Wright Brothers piece? It looks slabbed, but 'imperial' would make it to big, so I'm confused.

Scott:

I just received your PM and replied back to you.

Thanks
